message.content:
cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.CL 

The paper discusses the role of acknowledgements in scholarly communication, particularly in the humanities. The study provides a framework to understand acknowledgements as part of the reward system in science, with a special focus on their value in the humanities as a reflection of intellectual indebtedness. The paper also highlights the distinctive features of research in the humanities and the role of acknowledgements as a source of contributorship information. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
